Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells with Ni-MnO/yttria-stabilized-zirconia (YSZ) tricomposite anode supports were fabricated with different MnO concentrations, and the coking tolerances and catalytic activities were investigated in wet CH4 atmosphere.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: Ni-0.9(MnO)(0.1)/YSZ (10MnO) anode support cell exhibited a maximum power density of 210, 354, 505, and 620 mWcm(-2) at 700, 750, 800, and 850 degrees C, respectively, in H-2.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: Moreover, a maximum power density in wet CH4 reaches 504 mWcm(-2) at 800 degrees C; while the Ni/YSZ cell showed poorer performances.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: The coking tolerance improved with an increase in their MnO content, and the 10MnO anode showed the highest tolerance.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: 10MnO exhibited stable performance for more than 40 h in wet CH4 without undergoing deactivation.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: Furthermore, it showed negligible coke formation of 0.0045 g of coke per catalyst, during testing under steam reforming-like conditions at a steam-to-carbon (S/C) ratio of 1.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: Outlet gas chromatography analysis indicated that MnO suppresses CH4 cracking, while only minimally lowering the catalytic activity of steam reforming.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: Thus, it can be inferred that MnO promotes the adsorption of steam and oxygen on the reaction sites, owing to its high basicity and oxygen storage capacity.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs

Sentencas: The increase in the local S/C and oxygen-to-carbon ratios suppresses CH4 cracking and promotes coke gasification.
Titulo: Effects of Manganese Oxide Addition on Coking Behavior of Ni/YSZ Anodes for SOFCs
